meanings.definition: Of or relating to a lion.
meanings.sent1: The lionly roar echoed through the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper admired the lionly mane of the majestic creature.
meanings.sent3: The lionly statue in the park always made children smile.
meanings.sent4: Her lionly courage in the face of danger inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The lionly gaze of the king of the jungle struck fear into the hearts of all who dared to approach.

meanings.definition: In the manner of a lion.
meanings.sent1: The lionly prowling of the predator signaled its hunt.
meanings.sent2: The lion moved lionly across the grassy plain.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to walk lionly, imitating the big cats in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: She danced lionly across the stage, commanding attention with each step.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled lionly through the night, mimicking the call of the wild.

meanings.definition: Resembling a lion in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The lionly features of the costume made him the star of the play.
meanings.sent2: Her lionly courage in the face of adversity was truly admirable.
meanings.sent3: The lionly growl of the dog surprised everyone at the park.
meanings.sent4: The lionly strength of the athlete was unmatched in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The lionly pride in her eyes showed her determination to succeed.
